titleStmt.title: The poore mans ieuuel, that is to say, A treatise of the pestilence unto the which is annexed a declaration of the vertues of the hearbs Carduus Benedictus, and angelica, which are very medicinabl[e], both against the plague, and also against many other diseases / gathered out of the bookes of diuers learned physitians.
titleStmt.author: Brasbridge, Thomas, fl. 1590.

titleStmt.title: The poore mans ieuuel, that is to say, A treatise of the pestilence unto the which is annexed a declaration of the vertues of the hearbs Carduus Benedictus, and angelica, which are very medicinabl[e], both against the plague, and also against many other diseases / gathered out of the bookes of diuers learned physitians.
titleStmt.author: Brasbridge, Thomas, fl. 1590.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the British Library.
